result.execSummary:
The defendant Jhon T. Krebs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $253.04 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $25.30 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Restitution to Antique Liquor - Ck No 010854
Restitution to Hancock Mini Mart - Ck No 010855

Case Called @ 2:05 PM: Defendant Jhon T. Krebs in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Def has paid restitution in full - $253.04.  State recommends simple costs as penalty.  Def confirms resolution.  Def advised of right to counsel.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of counsel.  No statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - imposes Court Costs only plus DNA surcharge.  60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.

10:37 am case called. Defendant Jhon T. Krebs in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, stated on the record-defendant wishes to have additional time to pay restitution.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3. Court sets matter for sentencing in approximately 30 days for restitution to be paid.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-04-2015 11:15 am.
Defendant is prohibited from issuing any checks for payment.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case called @ 2:09 p.m.  Defendant Jhon T. Krebs in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant does not wish to have counsel at this time.   NGP entered. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 11:15 am.
from DE requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
